intro: Androsace limprichtii, commonly known as the Alpine sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the high-altitude regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in early summer. Its leaves are usually fleshy and arranged in a rosette pattern, adapted to retain moisture in arid environments. Androsace limprichtii thrives in rocky soils and is often found in alpine meadows and mountainous regions.
